8.8.19  9:56 am   Should air conditioners be called air conditioners, when in fact they bear no resemblance to conditioner, a hair product?

     they actually do. it's the conditioning part they have in common

      If so, does air possess some kind of invisible hair that requires daily maintenance through conditioning?

     no, it's the air that needs conditioning. not hair

      But then why doesn't air require shampoo?

     no hair

      Does air use a secret two-in-one product secreted from AC units that is undetectable to humans?

     sometimes both the temperature and humidity are conditioned

8.7.19  4:44 pm   when working with applescript, are you pretty much working directly with the UI, just like with mouse movements, menu items, etc. or have you been working with programs directly, kinda hack FCP or something?

      that would be preferable

8.7.19  3:24 pm   why do some artists have songs that are completely ruined by mono audio. i only have hearing in one ear and it makes things very frustrating

      if you haven't already, i think it's very important that you find out how to set your device(s) to mono, so that all the sound plays out of both sides. i'm quite sure the vast majority of phones, computers, and audio listening devices are capable of this, and if not, i think in the future you should always be sure to only get devices with that capability, especially if you are using headphones. actually you can probably get headphones that automatically convert to mono

8.7.19  1:45 pm   Have you considered strength training so you can slow the inevitable process of senescence granting you the physical tools needed to play music for the maximum time given in your allotted lifespan? 

      yes

8.7.19  12:10 pm   Serious question: your music has a masterful way of building tension and then resolving it; using both clever chord progressions and cadences as well as melodic fills-- then it swings effortlessly back into a catchy hook or chorus. This honestly feels similar to how baroque music works. What is your thought process when you compose these things? Is it instinct, or is all of this meticulously planned using advanced music theory? Anyway, sorry for the long question, big fan and fellow musician here trying to analyze your style.

      what works best for me is a door touch, kind of a superstition, re-setting my mind from a new listener's point of view, then play the existing song as far as it goes, with metranome, from beginning. then, at the moment when i reach the 'end' (or as far as it goes so far), that's the moment i listen very very carefully. only in that moment, after a clean run through, will i hear the solution. after a window of about 3 to 5 seconds, it gets much much less likely to get a reliable answer. at that point, i can do one of 2 things. i can go ahead and do another door touch and start again, or, if i've done too many run-throughs in a row and burned out the effectiveness of the run-through, i will try to play process of elimination. play detective with it a little. try to at least categorize all imaginable solutions. kind of like on 20 questions where they start by asking 'is it bigger than a breadbox'
